intro: Didissandra brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited didissandra, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruits are berry-like and typically mature to a red color. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
